name: df-symrel
body: |- wb(wsymrel(c0), wa(wss(ccnv(cin(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))), cin(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))), wrel(c0)))
comment: Define the symmetric relation predicate. (Read: ` R ` is a symmetric relation.) For sets, being an element of the class of symmetric relations ( ~ df-symrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the symmetric relation predicate, see ~ elsymrelsrel . Alternate definitions are ~ dfsymrel2 and ~ dfsymrel3 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 16-Jul-2021.)
